params.name: specifications
params.doc: List of coupon specifications to be created.

description: The `bulkCreateCoupons()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the coupons are created.
The `bulkDeleteCoupons()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the coupons are deleted.

The `createCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the new coupon when it is created.

When creating a coupon, the `specification` object must contain values for `name`, `code`, `startTime`, and either `scope` or `minimumSubtotal`. The exception is for a `freeShipping` coupon type, for which you cannot apply a `scope` and `minimumSubtotal` is optional.

The coupon `scope` defines the items a coupon applies to. A coupon can apply to all items in a specific Wix application, a group within the application, or a single item within a group. See the [introduction](#introduction) for a table of currently supported coupon scopes.

The `specification` object must also contain a value for exactly 1 of the following coupon properties. This defines the coupon type.

+ `"moneyOffAmount"`
+ `"percentOffRate"`
+ `"freeShipping"`
+ `"fixedPriceAmount"`
+ `"buyXGetY"`

description: The `getCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified coupon is retrieved.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 coupons with pagination and filters.
description: The `queryCoupons()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the coupons are retrieved.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the coupon to update.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update (required - passing an empty `fieldMask` will return an error). Valid field masks are any of those in the `specification` field.

description:
The `updateCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the coupon is updated.

Only the properties passed in the `specification` object will be updated. All other properties will remain the same.

To remove a value from the coupon, pass its corresponding property with a value of `null`.

When updating a coupon, you cannot change the coupon's `type`. For example, if the coupon's `type` is `moneyOffAmount`, you cannot change it to `fixedPriceAmount`. You can update the coupon type's value. For example, you can change the value of `moneyOffAmount` from `5` to `10`.

The coupon `scope` defines the items a coupon applies to. A coupon can apply to all items in a specific Wix application, a group within the application, or a single item within a group.
See the [introduction](#introduction) for a table of currently supported coupon scopes.

ID of Wix app that applied the coupon. Supported values:
+ Wix Stores - `1380b703-ce81-ff05-f115-39571d94dfcd`
+ Wix Bookings - `13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97`

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.doc: ID of the coupon to retrieve.

members.name: coupon
members.doc: Retrieved coupon.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the specific item in the group for which the coupon is applicable. If no `entityId` is specified, the coupon applies to all items in the group. In some cases when a group is specified, an `entityId` is required. See the [introduction](#introduction) for a list of currently supported entities for each namespace and group.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of coupon scope's group (e.g., product or collection in Wix Stores). See the [introduction](#introduction) for a table of currently supported coupon scopes.

members.name: hasCoupons
members.doc: True if site has ever had a coupon.

members.name: uniqueUserIdentifier
members.doc: Unique identifier of a buyer that applied the coupon. Used to limit coupon use per customer.

members.name: usedBy
members.doc: Unique ID of the entity that the coupon was applied to (e.g., orderId).

members.name: wixAppId
members.doc: ID of app that applied the coupon (e.g. bookings appDefId).

members.name: _id
members.doc: Coupon ID.

members.name: uniqueUserIdentifier
members.doc: Unique identifier of a buyer that applied the coupon. Used to limit coupon use per customer.

members.doc: Unique ID of the entity that the coupon was applied to (e.g., orderId).

members.name: wixAppId
members.doc: ID of app that applied the coupon (e.g. bookings appDefId).

members.name: error
members.doc: Errors, in case call failed.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Line item amount (while quantity = 1).

members.name: appliedDiscount
members.doc: Applied discount on line item after calculation.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Item ID in the external system - will usually be a product ID.

members.name: lineId
members.doc: Cart line item ID - represents index position (required).

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Line item quantity. Must be greater than 0.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Coupon scopes this line item applies to.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Whether the line item is of type subscription.

description: represents a single line in the cart

members.name: height
members.doc: Media item height.

members.name: url
members.doc: Media item URL.

members.name: width
members.doc: Media item width.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset since the beginning of the collection.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter string (e.g., when {"expired":"true"}, expired coupons will be returned).

members.name: paging
members.doc: Optional pagination parameters

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort string.

members.name: coupons
members.doc: Returned coupons.

members.name: totalResults
members.doc: Total results.

members.name: group
members.doc: Group within a `namespace` for which the coupon is applicable. If no group is specified, the coupon applies to all items in the namespace. `group` is required in some cases. See the table in the [introduction](#introduction) for a list of currently supported groups for each namespace.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: Scope namespace (Wix Stores, Wix Bookings, Wix Events, Wix Pricing Plans)

members.name: amount
members.doc: Shipping price before applying the coupon.

members.name: appliedDiscount
members.doc: Discount on shipping price.

description:
represents the shipping line in the cart
the coupons need to know about it because of the free shipping coupon

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the coupon is currently [active](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-activating-and-deactivating-coupons).

Default: `true`

members.name: appliesToSubscriptions
members.doc:
Whether the coupon applies to subscription products.

If set to `true`, the discount will apply to all billing cycles.

members.name: buyXGetY
members.doc:
Receive free products when making a purchase.

For example, purchase `x` number of products and receive `y` number of products for free.

members.name: code
members.doc:
Coupon code. Must be unique for all coupons on your site.

Max: 20 characters

members.name: discountedCycleCount
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: expirationTime
members.doc: Coupon expires at this date and time.

members.name: fixedPriceAmount
members.doc: Fixed sale price.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc:
Free shipping.

If `true`, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces`.

members.name: limitPerCustomer
members.doc: Maximum number of times the coupon can be used per customer.

members.name: limitedToOneItem
members.doc:
Whether the coupon is limited to one item.

If `true` and a customer pays for multiple items, the discount applies to only the lowest priced item.
Coupons with a `bookings` `scope.namespace` are always limited to one item.

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: The coupon is only applicable when the order subtotal is over this amount.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Discount as a fixed amount.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of coupon.

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: scope
members.doc: Specifies the type of line items this coupon will apply to. See the [introduction](#introduction) for a table of currently supported coupon scopes.

members.name: startTime
members.doc: Coupon valid from this date and time.

members.name: type
members.doc: Coupon type. Read-only.

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc:
Maximum number of times the coupon can be used.

>**Note:** Multiple purchases by the same customer or purchases by different customers are both counted toward `usageLimit`.

members.name: buyXGetY
members.doc:
Receive free products when making a purchase.

For example, purchase `x` number of products and receive `y` number of products for free.

members.name: fixedPriceAmount
members.doc: Fixed sale price.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc:
Free shipping.

If `true`, the coupon applies to all items in all `namespaces`.

members.name: moneyOffAmount
members.doc: Discount as a fixed amount.

members.name: percentOffRate
members.doc: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: The coupon is only applicable when the order subtotal is over this amount.

members.name: scope
members.doc: Specifies the type of line items this coupon will apply to. See the [introduction](#introduction) for a table of currently supported coupon scopes.

members.name: discount
members.doc: Sum of all discounts.

members.name: subTotal
members.doc: Cart subtotal.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the coupon to update.

members.name: specification
members.doc: Coupon information to update.
